intro: Homanthis, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in the evening. Homanthis produces small, round berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Due to its toxic properties, it is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
